author: Elaine Glusac
title: Tour and Resort News: Tennis in Florida; Paddleboards in Africa - The New York Times
text:
Continue reading the main story Share This Page Continue reading the main story Continue reading the main story GRAND SLAM COURTS AT A FLORIDA RESORT
With a renovation of its tennis club, Fisher Island Club Hotel & Resort off the tip of Miami Beach has added two red clay courts to become one of the rare resorts to offer all four of tennisâ€™s Grand Slam playing surfaces. Its 18 courts include hard courts such as those used in the U.S. Open and Australian Open, grass courts as found at the Wimbledon tournament, the new clay courts used at the annual French Open and additional green clay courts. Guests can book court time on the surface of their choice (from $17 per person, per day). Rooms start at $575 in October and at $1,100 beginning in November.
